docs.abstract: The European Union outlined proposals to bolster its digital economy and keep it from being overly reliant on foreign companies, while cracking down on those companies.
docs.snippet: The European Union outlined proposals to bolster its digital economy and keep it from being overly reliant on foreign companies, while cracking down on those companies.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Across the digital economy, Europe has been missing.

headline.main: Europe, Overrun by Foreign Tech Giants, Wants to Grow Its Own
headline.print_headline: Europe Seeks to Plant Its Own Tech Cash Crop

byline.original: By Adam Satariano and Monika Pronczuk

docs.abstract: Supply is a problem, the company warned, as factories slowly reopen in China, and demand is down, too, with stores there still mostly closed.
docs.snippet: Supply is a problem, the company warned, as factories slowly reopen in China, and demand is down, too, with stores there still mostly closed.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Apple on Monday became one of the first companies to reveal how the coronavirus that has gripped China was affecting its business, saying it was cutting its sales expectations for this quarter, which a month ago it had projected to be robust.

headline.main: Apple Signals Coronavirus’s Threat to Global Businesses
headline.print_headline: Apple Expects Sales to Suffer After Outbreak

docs.abstract: Despite their high-tech tools, the authorities are mainly relying on a flood of workers to keep hundreds of millions of people from coming in contact with outsiders.
docs.snippet: Despite their high-tech tools, the authorities are mainly relying on a flood of workers to keep hundreds of millions of people from coming in contact with outsiders.
docs.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — China has flooded cities and villages with battalions of neighborhood busybodies, uniformed volunteers and Communist Party representatives to carry out one of the biggest social control campaigns in history.

headline.main: To Tame Coronavirus, Mao-Style Social Control Blankets China
headline.print_headline: A Quarantine, Mao-Style, of 760 Million People

byline.original: By Raymond Zhong and Paul Mozur

docs.abstract: The world’s richest man unveiled a fund to help climate scientists and activists, an escalation of his philanthropic efforts.
docs.snippet: The world’s richest man unveiled a fund to help climate scientists and activists, an escalation of his philanthropic efforts.
docs.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Jeff Bezos, Amazon’s chief executive and the world’s richest man, said on Monday that he was committing $10 billion to address the climate crisis in a new initiative he called the Bezos Earth Fund.

headline.main: Jeff Bezos Commits $10 Billion to Address Climate Change
headline.print_headline: Bezos Pledges $10 Billion Fund To Address Climate Change

docs.abstract: Leslie Wexner, who built L Brands into a retailing force, had come under scrutiny for his ties to the disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein.
docs.snippet: Leslie Wexner, who built L Brands into a retailing force, had come under scrutiny for his ties to the disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein.
docs.lead_paragraph: For decades Leslie H. Wexner helped shape the modern shopping mall, his brands populating the space between department stores — Victoria’s Secret, Abercrombie & Fitch, Express, Bath & Body Works and more.

headline.main: Victoria’s Secret Sale Caps End of Wexner’s Retail Empire
headline.print_headline: Wexner Says  He’s Leaving  A Pioneer  Of Retailing

byline.original: By Sapna Maheshwari and Jessica Silver-Greenberg

docs.abstract: The $13 billion deal will give a powerful Wall Street firm control of a major presence in the world of online brokerage firms.
docs.snippet: The $13 billion deal will give a powerful Wall Street firm control of a major presence in the world of online brokerage firms.
docs.lead_paragraph: Morgan Stanley is betting its future on Main Street.

headline.main: Morgan Stanley to Buy E-Trade, Linking Wall Street and Main Street
headline.print_headline: Wall St.’s Morgan Stanley  To Buy Main St.’s E-Trade

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced, Kate Kelly and Emily Flitter

docs.abstract: With the addition of Michael Bloomberg, the forum on NBC and MSNBC drew nearly 20 million viewers, beating the Golden Globes and Grammys.
docs.snippet: With the addition of Michael Bloomberg, the forum on NBC and MSNBC drew nearly 20 million viewers, beating the Golden Globes and Grammys.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Democratic presidential candidates smashed a ratings record on Wednesday night, drawing a combined audience of 19.7 million to the latest primary debate, Nielsen said on Thursday.

headline.main: Democrats Set a TV Ratings Record at Their Las Vegas Debate
headline.print_headline: Las Vegas Primary Clash Sets a TV Ratings Record

docs.abstract: His campaign is testing the boundaries of what platforms like Twitter and Facebook allow in politics. They’re having trouble coming up with an answer.
docs.snippet: His campaign is testing the boundaries of what platforms like Twitter and Facebook allow in politics. They’re having trouble coming up with an answer.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — In the first few months of his presidential campaign, Michael R. Bloomberg has been as aggressive on social media as President Trump was four years ago. But with a lot more money to spend.

headline.main: Digital Edits, a Paid Army: Bloomberg Is ‘Destroying Norms’ on Social Media

byline.original: By Sheera Frenkel and Davey Alba

docs.abstract: In his influential annual letter to chief executives, Mr. Fink said his firm would avoid investments in companies that “present a high sustainability-related risk.”
docs.snippet: In his influential annual letter to chief executives, Mr. Fink said his firm would avoid investments in companies that “present a high sustainability-related risk.”
docs.lead_paragraph: Laurence D. Fink, the founder and chief executive of BlackRock, announced Tuesday that his firm would make investment decisions with environmental sustainability as a core goal.

headline.main: BlackRock C.E.O. Larry Fink: Climate Crisis Will Reshape Finance
headline.print_headline: New Lodestar For BlackRock: Climate Crisis

docs.abstract: The glut of shows has created more opportunities, but short seasons and unpredictable schedules have made life tricky.
docs.snippet: The glut of shows has created more opportunities, but short seasons and unpredictable schedules have made life tricky.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — It seemed like a good deal. At first.

headline.main: Streaming TV’s Boom Is a Mixed Blessing for Some Hollywood Writers
headline.print_headline: Streaming Boom Is Making Life Tricky for TV Writers
